title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
To start off, This board and the schematics i aquired seem to be different. Some bits on the schematic appear to be missing compared to all of the 820-00165 boards i have.  

I am measuring dcin and only getting 18v instead of 25v The backlight connector does not get above 8v.
Not sure where to go from here. Have tried multiple dc in boards and connectors.
We also do not get power unless both the battery and charger are plugged in.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
"I am measuring dcin and only getting 18v instead of 25v"
Where exactly and why assume 25V???

I recommend you solve the power problem before go ahead.
Exact value for PPBUS_G3H with charger and w/ and w/o battery?
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of ISL6259.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
PPBUS_G3H  with battery reads 8.55v
PPBUS_G3H without battery reads 8.56v
Resistance Between pin 17/18 is 3.2 and pin 27/28 is reading 20.5

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Seems to have a problem with battery bus.
Check resistance to ground (diode mode) for SCL/SDA lines of that bus.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
SCL is giving 11.23kohm pin4
SDA is giving 46.5 kohm pin5

This is with red on left usb for ground black on pins.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
My mistake other way around. SCL is 46.5
SDA us 11.23
EDIT: the readings seem to keep flipping. keeping red on earth all the time..

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
"(diode mode)"
Diode mode (not ohm scale), red probe to ground, to be more specific...

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message: Right .were closing now. I'm pretty sure that was diode mode but maybe I had it set wtong

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
You can't get "kohm" mark on diode mode...
Less than 1% difference is required there.
Even ohm scale, gave you bigger difference.
Don't forget to check voltage too.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Ok I believe I have the right setting.
i am using a fluke 15b+.
I rotated the selection to the ohm symbol and pressed the yellow button twice. I now have a diode symbol in the top right .presumably this is what you meant.  

SCL reads 0.504v
sca reads 0.502v

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message: Any ideas?

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
The values are pretty equal.
But you should also get similar difference on ohm scale...
Post voltage for both lines too.
Does the board start on charger only (no battery)?

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
The board does not start on charger only. 
scl is giving 3.414
SDA is giving 3.414

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of ISL6259.

Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message: Left for the weekend. Will tell my boss who Is working today your instructions .thanks greatly for the help :)

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Pin 9 is fluctuation between 0.120 and 0.183v
pin 15 is 0.072 each time the fan starts to spin up and drops to 0

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message: smc bypass boots.. doesnt seem to be turning of altough fans are running extremely loud.. could this mean dead smc?

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Fan spins at max in SMC bypass mode, that is normal behaviour.
You have some sensor which blocks SMC to start.
Check the sensors output from page 42.
Start with SMC_DCIN_VSENSE and SMC_PBUS_VSENSE.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
smc dcin vsense is 18v
smc pbus vsense is 8.5v
smc cpu isense is 0.122v
we have no u5570
we have no u5560
we have no u5590
cpuvr adjust isense is 0.003
no u5670
any more we need?

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message: Should we reflow smc

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
"smc dcin vsense is 18v
smc pbus vsense is 8.5v"
Are you sure???
SMC is fried then; it cannot recieve such overvoltage on any input.
Be sure to measure on C5504/14...

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
C5505 reads 1.426
c5514 reads 3.119
but q5510 on pin 3 measure 18.5v

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
"C5505 reads 1.426"
If is C5504, that's good.

C5514 voltage is good enough.
Check the sensors from pages 41 & 43 too.
Pay atention to A/BMON sensors...

Be sure R7051/52 have both correct value.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
I could not find r7052/51
but on amon sense r5431 i get 0.241
on bmon sense r5472 1.051

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
"Be sure R7051/52 have both correct value."
Sorry for my error; read in other way...
Be sure R7151/52 have both correct value.

my mistake, I should i have said i was plugging it back in to double check the dc values just incase i measured them wrong. 
Any idea where to go from from here? No light no fans =/ or do you think this is a done board,

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Probably hopeless repair.
But if you got some experience from it, is no  time waste at least...

Post voltages for 3V42 and PPBUS_G3H.
If no volt, post resistance to ground; allow 20s after power is removed.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
It is good experience yes. And being new to this, thats very much what i need. Just to check to check oltages for 3v2 and ppbus_g3h i put one probe on earth and one probe on the corrosponding component.
(ill check schematic to figure out which components that is). How do you know what voltages parts should be outputing? I originally got the 25v i spoke of a the start of this thread from the schematic.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
None of mentioned points can have 25V.
No idea where did you get that high voltage...

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen

on pp3v42_g3h im getting 3.419 volts. measured this on c5120 r5127

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Resistance to ground on F7140?
Post some voltages for ISL6259, basic pins 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 17, 18, 19, 20, 27, 28.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message: Just to check, resistance to ground is measured via the ohm selection and with the board being unpowered. black pin on ground red on output? or both on either side of the component.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Red probe to ground, diode mode.
Switch to ohm mode for very low value, like measuring between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Or in case of VCORE power rail, which can drop untill 1 ohm...

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
F7140 is 0.152v on pin 2
isl6259
2 is 0.614v
3 is 0.512v
9 is 0.705v
12 is 0.306v
13 is 0.481v
15 is 0.724v
17 is 0.659 k ohm
18 is 0.655 k ohm
19 is 0.267v
20 is 0.269v
27 is 9.47 m ohm
28 is 5.81 m ohm


think that about covers it. On this boad its called u7100, just checking thats what you meant as there is no isl6259 on this board. 
weve replaced this before but maybe it was replaced with a bad one.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
"On this boad its called u7100, just checking thats what you meant as there is no isl6259 on this board."
As seen in schematic, U7100 is ISL6259...

"17 is 0.659 k ohm
18 is 0.655 k ohm"
I told you need to swith to ohm scale when measure between the pins; use diode mode to ground.
In fact, I didn't ask about resistance to ground on U7100 pins: "Post some voltages for ISL6259"

So, I'm waiting you reply...

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Sorry my bad i misunderstood. ill need to do a bit more research tomorrow on my day off, my boss went ahead and replaced the isl chip anyway. Ill get you voltages afterwards if its still not working.
thanks!

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Okay good news. replacing isl brought us back to the last step. it turns off in bypass mode but dies without bypass.
r7151 is 8.56
r7152 is 8.56

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message: He just replaced u5600 himself, now were getting 4v, so he replaced it the again and were still getting 4v.. im heading home now but ill check again on monday.

title: 820-00165 spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
message:
Why was replaced U5600?
Now must check for knocked off components, or broken traces.
Also check solders on the U7100.
And once again, I asked for the ohm value of R7151/52; resistor value, not resistance to ground, nor voltage.
I asked voltages for some pins of U7100, but never saw them...

When you get back PPBUS_G3H with correct value (8.5-8.6V), then check SMC_BMON_DISCRETE_ISENSE voltage.
